_exec_summary.SummaryText:
STAMOULES PRODUCE COMPANY - RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Stamoules Produce Company (S&S Produce) has a large facility for farm and fresh vegetable cold storage located in a rural area southwest of Mendota, California.  Anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant in three separate refrigeration systems for making ice and removing field heat from agricultural products for short term cold storage.



The Risk Management Program at Stamoules Produce Company complies with US EPA as well as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) program requirements.  In addition, the programs and policies in place comply with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations.



Note:  Per EPA recommendations, specifics of the off-site consequence analysis are not included in this executive summary as recommended for security.





ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Stamoules Produce Company is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment at the Stamoules Produce Company facility. 



It is the policy of Stamoules Produce Company to ensure that controls are in place to limit the risks of potential ammonia releases. If such a release does occur, the facility personnel are trained to evacuate and notify the local Fresno County Fire Department + HazMat Team to assist with the response.  In addition, Stamoules Produce Company maintains a close relationship with a local ammonia refrigeration contractor who is on-call 24/7 to assist and provide guidance.





STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Stamoules Produce Company is located near Mendota, California in a rural agricultural area.  Our facility's primary activities include cold storage of locally grown agricultural products such as

corn, broccoli, bell peppers, and melons.  The operations at the facility vary seasonally based on the harvest times for the various food products that are stored and distributed.



Anhydrous ammonia, which is a regulated substance, is maintained above the regulatory threshold quantity at our facility.  It is used as a refrigerant in three separate closed-loop refrigeration systems:  Main System, North System, South System.





ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND THE CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR Part 68 of the EPA (RMP) as well as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) program.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with applicable California Building Codes and updated to RAGAGEP standards.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that are in place at Stamoules Produce Company.



-Process Safety Information

Stamoules Produce Company maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment specifications associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment and process.  This includes design parameters and safe operating conditions, as well as details of the many safety features incorporated into the design of the ammonia refrigeration system.



-Process Hazard Analysis

Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to carry out these analyses is What if / Checklist, as recommended by IIAR.  The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of 5 years.  Any findings or recommendations associated with the analysis of hazards are addressed in a timely manner.

-Operating Procedures

For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, Stamoules Produce Company maintains written operating procedures.  These procedures address various phases of operation of the ammonia refrigeration equipment such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved with the processes.



-Training

Stamoules Produce Company attends regional training classes to ensure that employees who are operating processes are completely competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes.  Refresher training is provided at least every 3 years and more frequently as needed.  The refrigeration contractor also provides training to facility employees during routine site visits.



-Mechanical Integrity

Stamoules Produce Company carries out documented maintenance inspections and tests on ammonia process equipment to ensure the systems are maintained in safe working order.  Process equipment included in these checks are:  compressors, condensers, pressure vessels, pumps, storage tanks, piping systems, evaporators and heat exchangers, pressure relief systems, emergency shutdown systems, leak detection systems, and controls.  



Maintenance procedures are typically implemented by professional refrigeration contractors with strong qualifications and training in maintenance and service practices.  Specialized training is provided to these personnel as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified during maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.  In addition, facility employees routinely observe ammonia process equipment and notify the contractor in case of any abnormal conditions.



-Management of Change

Written procedures are in place at Stamoules Produce Company to manage changes in process chemicals, technolog

y, equipment, and procedures.  Process operators, maintenance personnel, and all other employees whose job tasks are affected by a change in an ammonia process are promptly made aware of and offered training to ensure the affected employees are kept informed and aware.



-Pre-Startup Safety Reviews

Pre-startup safety reviews related to new and/or modified regulated processes are conducted in conjunction with the Management of Change policy at Stamoules Produce Company.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.



-Compliance Audits

Stamoules Produce Company conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP Rule are being implemented.  These audits are carried out at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.



-Incident Investigation

Stamoules Produce Company promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of ammonia.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent similar situations from reoccurring.  All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.  Any incidents that meet the RMP Reportable criteria will be included in the facility's RMP Submit (5 Year Accident History) per EPA guidelines.



-Employee Participation

Stamoules Produce Company truly believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort.  Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our employees have access to all information collected as part of the facility's compliance with the RMP Rule including information resulting from process hazard analyses.



-Hot Wo

rk Permit

At Stamoules Produce Company, Hot Work Permit procedures are in place and enforced regarding any hot work done on or near ammonia refrigeration process equipment.  Preventing accidents related to welding and cutting while alerting others at the facility that this type of work is occurring are important prevention steps.



-Contractor Safety

The Stamoules Produce Company facility hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities associated with the ammonia refrigeration processes.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out. Stamoules Produce Company has a strict policy of informing contractors of any known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes within the facility. Contractors are also informed of all procedures for emergency response and evacuation should an accidental ammonia release occur.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Stamoules Produce Company has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years.  Due to our stringent release prevention policies, there have been no accidental ammonia releases during this period at Stamoules Produce Company.



EPA's RMP regulation defines "accident" as the following: 



"The release must be from a covered process and involve a regulated substance held above its threshold quantity in the process. The release must have caused at least one of the following: 



-  On-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage (?68.42(a)); or

-  Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place (?68.42(a))."





EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Stamoules Produce Company has a written emergency action plan to deal with accidental releases of ammonia in addition to many other potential emergencies (i.e., fires, earthquakes, power outage, etc.).  The plan includes defensive actions that can be taken without entering a h

azardous area.  These actions include training for recognition of a hazard, evaluation, initial evacuation or protection measures, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.  The facility's refrigeration service contractor is also on call 24/7 to assist and provide guidance to appropriately deal with ammonia emergencies.



In addition, the Emergency Action Plan is regularly updated to reflect any changes that have occurred related to personnel or the ammonia refrigeration systems. Any changes in emergency contact personnel or contact information is corrected in the RMP within 30 days.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Stamoules Produce Company is committed to the safety of employees as well as neighboring residents and businesses.  Continual evaluations of risks associated with the ammonia refrigeration process by in-house personnel as well as outside risk management professionals help to limit the possibility of unintended impacts from the ammonia systems.



Items identified in studies such as the recent Process Hazard Analysis study will be implemented to further reduce the risks.  Stamoules Produce Company also plans to improve safety as follows:

 

-  Continued involvement of refrigeration and safety personnel in the ongoing development and implementation of the risk management policies.

-  Attendance and participation of key personnel in industry groups such as RETA and IIAR ensure the facility is aware of evolving industry standards and techniques used to encourage safety.

-  Conducting routine RMP and PSM meetings to ensure any issues identified by refrigeration personnel, contractors, consultants, or the safety department are discussed and addressed.
